Best sunset terrace!. Only had a drink, but we were there for the most memorable sunset! I will never forget it. The hotel looks really nice and lively.
Don't bother counting. There are more than 12. That's what my guide told us. Gorgeous drive. Amazing shorelines and sweeping vistas. Simply beautiful.
stunning. go to Camps Bay to get a great view of the peaks and take your camera - got some great shots of the clouds rolling over the mountains.
Spectacular views across the Apostle range. We viewed the 12, well 17 apostle peaks from the top of Table Mountain and from the coastline where they equally impressive.

Exquisite and spectacular. Leisurely drive around and soaking the fascinating views is hands down one of THE best in the world. Definitely no short-cuts advised. Take a trek or better still loll on the heavenly shoreline.

Amazing. The Twelve Apostles are 12 rock formations along the coast in Cape Town. A delightful drive along the coastline takes you to the Twelve Apostles hotel where you can enjoy a great meal and good drinks. These rock formations looking out over the water are immense and imposing. Great photo opportunities. Recommended

25th Wedding Anniversary celebration. We booked our trip through Go2Africa, they really made our 25th Anniversary a memorable one! We stayed at the Twelve Apostles Hotel, what a treat. The Hotel faces the sea and the views were spectacular. The Management and Staff made us feel very welcome and special. Our celebration dinner in the Azure Restaurant was a real highlight for us. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Go2Africa arranged a full day private winelands tour and our guide was very knowledgeable and interesting. All in all we loved our few days in Cape Town and found the city very clean and the people friendly. We will be back!

The weather helps. On a clear day the view is awesome, when the clouds are low and it is mist you see nothing, however, in-between the view is different every minute. Well worth the visit even if there is a blanket of cloud.

Friendly, professional, helpful. Excellent. My son and I enjoyed very much our stay at the hotel.From the concierge to the manager.. everyone was friendly and did his best to make us feel great. The atmosphere of the hotel is very cosy. Beautiful Paintings hang everywhere. There is also a library: Choose a book, enjoy the see view, drink a tea and try those cupcakes!The see view is fantastic. There is a free shuttle bus to drive you and pick you up from the hotel to Waterfront.They offer private tours too. We went to Franschhoek, discovered the area and visited many ceramic ateliers. The driver knew that my son is fond of engines so he took us to an impressive car museum. What a service! Highly recommended.

Romantic Honeymoon. My new husband and I stayed here from 10/30 through 11/2/14 as part of our trip planned by Lion World Travel. First, the Pros:- EXCELLENT STAFF! The head concierge (Mahood I think? I've slept a lot since then) was so incredibly nice to us as well as the front desk, drivers, and wait staff. We didn't encounter anyone that didn't go out of their way to help us. - Beautiful grounds with a walking path, spa, and pool- A little outside of busy Camps Bay and the Waterfront- Great views of the Atlantic- Great breakfast and food in both restaurantsNow the Con:- We upgraded to a sea-facing room since it was our honeymoon and we love to sleep to the sound of crashing waves. Well, you can hear the waves a little at night but between 10 pm and 6 am all you hear is the sound of cars on the 2 lane highway right below the balcony. On Saturday it sounded like Tokyo drift. I gave it 4 stars just because of the road noise, but other than that it was a wonderful stay. We had a great time on our honeymoon and would definitely return to the Twelve Apostles.

Variety is the spice of life. Brilliant Saturday market. Many quirky shops open daily.Casamento is my favourite furniture shop where the amazing furniture is the creation of Starry Eve and her partner. Expensive but worth every penny.

Watching the rain. We took cover at the hotel from a storm. They were so friendly giving us a royal tour of the hotel. Had a light lunch that was right on the number. Hot comfort food - we felt very welcome indeed. Thank you.

Better and Better. The Twelve Apostles continues to wow its guests with reliable and thoughtful service. Our room was upgraded. Staff constantly inquired if they could assist us in any way. Then, when we experienced a family crisis requiring us to return home to the USA immediately, the Twelve Apostles staff stepped-in to coordinate transportation and communication. Their generosity and thoughtfulness was incredible. The Twelve Apostles is definitely unique in the hospitality industry. Thank you.

Beautiful Hotel. Real quality up market hotel in a most beautiful natural surrounding and scenery with ocean views. Excellent Food, great service and value for money. Don't miss it on your drive down the Cape Pennisular.

Best Anniversary Celebration. The dinner, accommodation and breakfast was nothing short of amazing.
The service and food was excellent.
Will definitely be back
Hikers paradise. Hiking up the Twelve Apostels offer magnificent views of Hout Bay, Llandudno, Camps Bay and the ocean. There are about 2,200 species of plants on the mountain range.

Very nice hotel on the ocean. We treated ourselves and stayed here for 2 nights. Very nice and attentive staff and the restaurant onsite is great. Bit remote in that you are a mile out of the nearest urban area, but for us it was no problem especially with the hotel van service ready to get you into town as needed.

Broad band of Heaven. One can watch them from the The Table Top or take a drive down to Hout's Bay and you see this band of grand old mountains.Lovely restaurants built in the mountainous sides overlooking gorgeous bays and the Apostles .

12 apostles argument has 17 or 18. we were able to view these mountains three times. On the hop on hop off bus, our a guided tour to the capes both road trips and finally by air on the helicopter. Very different view and worth it

5 Stars+. Though some tourists may complain that the hotel is not "centrally located," when you consider that Cape Town's fame rests in large part on the physical beauty of its setting, there actually is no better located hotel that the 12 Apostles with its stunning views of both Table Mountain looming above it and the magnificent coastline below. Luxury without being ostentation, superb service - one of the most memorable hotel stays imaginable.

More like 17 apostles. The other side of the table mountain, the wonder indeed. one side if the table and the other is something else. when looking at the twelve apostles, looking closely you see that they are infact 17 of them, may be is just me, but the views are magnificent

magnificent views. there is nothing much that we didn't like. we like the décor, the quietness, the staff, the food and the absolute best was the view. we actually enquired about staying there another few night. However, even in low season, it's not easy to find 3 rooms there. Next time, we'll book long in advance.
Nice View - not great. That section of the shore is great for photos, and it is part of a nice scenic drive through the area.
Twelve-out-of-Ten. Great food,great views and great service. More expensive than your average steak house but it is absolute value for money.

awesome hike up to the mountain. we stayed in a villa that is only mins away from 12 apostles, we took a little hike up the mountain and it was just beautiful, great view, not too difficult a hike.... perfect for any day.

Its not shabby... but.... Don't get me wrong, Twelve Apostles isn't a bad place to stay... its just that its self image outstrips its reality. The staff tries to be attentive, but.. functions in a disorganized manner. The exception was the service staff that operated the shuttle service to Capetown. The rooms are nice, but not super special. One night a candle appears, the next night it doesn't. Same with water.Since the hotel is built into the side of the mountain, rooms are found after covering many hallways on different 3-6 step levels. Breakfasts are great, many choices. Maybe if your focus is the beach area, this is a good choice. If your focus is Capetown, as was ours, then you might want to seek other options.

Great romantic place !. On our wa back from chapmans peak, we stopped there for a drink. We liked the place so much that we decided to go there for dinner the next day. It s not very far. Only 4 km from Camps Bay. Great views.

Sunday lunch. This is a hidden gem with a veiw of Table Mountain & the sea. Beautifull walks & setting. The food when we fist discovered it in 2010 was an unbelievable 6 stars. Lately, i would only give the food 4 stars, but still worth it for a romantic Sunday lunch.

Sunday Brunch on the deck - beautiful!. We were fortunate to have wonderful weather for a Sunday Brunch at Twelve Apostles. The choices for main courses were numerous as well as the choices for starters & desserts. They also had entertainment which we enjoyed. Debi was playing American songs that we recognized so that was fun. We had to stop ourselves from eating too much, everything was so tastey. The view of the bay was gorgeous as we dined. We were hopeful we would see whales as our guide, Peter, said there had been sightings of them but we weren't lucky during our time there. I would recommend this restaurant's Sunday Brunch definitely!

Lovely drive past it.. The drives from Cape Town to the south are always just amazing. You have to do these drives - past the 12 apostles and then to cape point through the pass (tolls apply) - stop frequently to take in the amazing vistas
Beautiful backdrop. Went on the blue and red bus tours from Capetown and the mountains provided a great backdrop to pictures taken from the top of an open deck bus.

Day tour to Cape Point,. Having left Icy and windy table mountain, lions head,and Clifton beach rather bare of surfers today ;We drove past these huge and spectactular mountains, before a cliff top drive along chapman's Peak, a drive to rival Australia's Great ocean road.

Fantastic seafood dinner. Very nice ambience for special occasion. Great dinner service and delicious food. Service on patio for pre-dinner drinks was lacking. Patio was empty and not really set for guests. Was not a comfortable place to be. We felt out of place, no candles on tables, just completely empty tables and chairs. Big shame as that should have been a highlight of the evening. Hence only 3 stars.

Favourite Hotel in Cape Town. This Hotel is truly Cape Towns best! Everything from the rooms to restaurant is amazing. We had a beautiful evening at the hotel with a superb dinner in the Azure Restaurant. Would definitely recommend to stay here

As good as it gets. A truly superb hotel with really good food and wines plus a stunning position south of Cape Town. Great sea views - we saw over a hundred wales sailing past!
Recommend to anyone as a first class place to see the Cape area. They run a free service to take guests into the city and pitch you up again.
Stunning. Beautiful range of Mountain tops. I drove past them at least 4 times a week and also climbed up on them. You can have a stunning view over Camps Bay and Lions Head.

Stunning. The views here are breathtaking, and stunning. Even though it was Winter and the wind was quite brisk, we were able to get some beautiful shots and just to enjoy the natural settings that we don't get to see in urban surroundings. It is well worth the drive to see them from all angles.

12 Reasons.... Ok so there are more than 12 reasons to visit the 12 Apostles. Best viewed from Camps Bay or Lions Head. There are also hiking trails up there. Or drive along them from Camps Bay to Hout Bay.
If you do decide to hike up there just remember: do it in a group ;)
Nice. Lovely to see but only if you are passing through anyway to get a nice photo. I think it is covered in lots of tours and is a nice place to stop for a photo.

Spectacular Apostles. With Table Mountain as a backdrop the sheer unspoilt rugged beauty takes your breath away. Looming mountains on one side and the sparkling ocean on the other- it does not get any better than this

They actually are a big deal. I don't think many people know that the famous hotel is named after a range of mountain peaks. Some say that the Twelve Apostles are even more significant than Table Mountain itself. The beach and neighboring coastline sure is impressive!When you drive along the coast again, take some time to stop and look at the Twelve Apostles, as in the mountain peaks. There are actually 18 of them, but try and count the 12 that are near the famous hotel and spa that has the same name :)

5 Star hotel on the a Rocks above the Atlantic Ocean.. The only hotel and buildings along this section of the coast. Great food and drinks for a quick stop over and fantastic rooms. The spa is definitely worth a visit

Fab treatments. Just visited the spa and had a fantastic time. The staff is very polite, attentive to clients needs. I received a shell massage and my husband a deep tissue. Great treatments done by professionals.The spa area is large with different pools available

Great sundowners in the Leopard Bar. We love this hotel! We stayed here two years ago and had the most wonderful time. The room (suite), food, service, atmosphere, location were all first-class. On this trip we were staying at the Waterfront, but had to make a special visit for sundowners in the Leopard Bar. We'll be back.

Unbelievable Birthday celebration. We had Sunday lunch at 12A to celebrate my birthday on 17 August. The weather was gorgeous, ambiance & music so great. The food was excellent. We were treated very well, waiters are well trained & professional. I was given a bottle of bubbly to celebrate my birthday. My day was so unbelievable. Thank you. Lauren Price is the best customer relationship officer. What a professional, diligent lady.
Sunset drive. Absolutely stuning and a must. A sunset here is the best. Bring your camera and maybe a picnic basket

The place for sundowners. Spectacular views over the ocean,combined with well prepared cocktails makes this one of our a favorite.Service can be a hit and miss, but then you still have the amazing sunset...
Best service. Lovely hotel, many choices where to eat. Spa is lovely and had amazing products. Azure restaurant is top notch.
Cocktails by sunset. Came here for cocktails, very classy place, the view is amazing and the cocktails were divine! You can either dress up or dress down, anything goes.

The Cloud Distillery. As clouds rolled over the top of table mountain they filtered down the gullies between each Apostle like a distillation tower. Really breathtaking from the beach and from lions head. A stunning location.
World best Rocks. Along the way from Cape Town to Camps Bay, you can see this Beautiful 12 Apostles. This looks like Rocks. Don't just passing by this point.
just stopped by.. On our way to Cape Point, we stopped at the beach for a photo op with the Twelve Apostles in the background. Views are amazing!
a picture postcard view. loved it,if you are in capetown u have to go here and take a picture.its a beautiful view !it is something i associate with capetown...

The gem of Cape Town. They have thought of every detail and you really want for nothing. Their mixologists are of the best I've ever had the pleasure of making cocktails. .highly recommend the Golden Giraffe! Best Bar snacks even outdoing the Oyster Box. The spa is fantastic and staff not too stuffy....everyone is friendly and they bend over backwards. The Azure Restaurant I have already rated as *****.Breakfast is a treat and the oysters and salmon are fresh. The only downer was my wife slipping on the wet deckbut fortunately is only a sprain. We will be back again asap!

Best hotel. We spend a weekend at this hotel during our honeymoon . The hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The views from our room were amazing. I will certainly be going back to this hotel.

Very scenic. The table mountain range stretches all the way from Capetown to Cape Point and makes for a very scenic 90 minute drive. The range starts with the Lions Head, and continues as Table Montain and then a series of small mountain peaks that run along the coast all the way to Cape Point. The drive is very scenic with several points from which yo get amazing views of the bay from different perspectives.
Good views . Firstly it is not just twelve apostles. There are definitely more!! They make for a good sight on a clear day when passing by or spending time at the camps bay and Clifton beaches.
wonderfull. what a sight I shall never forget these huge mountains and how the colours change by the hour especially magical at sunset with the red hues and greys to browns

Great view - aveage service. I only had lunch here so cannot say anything about the hotel but the waiters were below average at best. Whenever I come here I am always very eloquently greeted by the maître d but this eloquence does not extend to the waiters. Waiters here almost have a eagerness to the flip the table for the next set of diners but when you are paying 12 apostle prices that is not what you come here for. Another point is that waiters also lack colonial crispness - ties are loose, buttons undone, shoes not polished - the reason this stands out is because the look of these waiting staff does not reflect the quality and opulence which the hotel strives for. The food is good but definitely not the best on the Atlantic side and could be described as good tapas for a sea-side café except that it is not. The view however, wow, that does make up for it - more than make up for it. In conclusion, come dine here for a great view but don't expect what comes out of the kitchen to wow Gordon Ramsay in terms of taste and service.

monument of nature. it is nice to see it exactly next to the top of the table mountain againt the lion head, if you see it as a complex of mountains is a nice view, but one more time i say that the best view is by helicopter
Beautiful backdrop. The 12 Apostles mountain range is simply stunning!! It is such a great backdrop to Camps Bay, and just makes Camps Bay beach look even better!!

Ahem....!! Hmmmmm....!! Still thinking what to write.... The South Africans are good at one thing. Give them any natural rock formation,they will brand it. And voila...it adorns all the tourist sites, maps, offices as a natural MustSee wonder. Well, twelve. apostles is one such site. Nothing spectacular. All you do is tick one more thing off the Must do list in Cape Town.

Twelve Apostles. We lived in Camps Bay just on the foot of the Twelve Apostles. Table Mountain from this side is even more beautiful than on its ordinary view. Clouds just flew down as water from above to the balcony of our apartment. It's a unique feeling - dinner with wine in the middle of cloudy mist. This is also the luxury region of the city were you can meet different celebrities and have all kinds of leasure time. And Camps Bay beech is one of the most beautiful in Cape Town, but the ocean is very cold, only few braves can swim.

Great place for a special occasion. Service was fantastic. They have a great wine selection. The food was good too.There is a fantastic view out over the atlantic. If the weather is good try to time your visit for sun set and have a drink on the balcony at the same time, it's well worth it!
Great Back Drop. As most know, it is hard to beat this back drop as the sun is setting. There are several spots in and around Camps Bay for great pictures.

Wonderfull stay. Its been a real wonderfull hotel to have stayed in. The moment you walk in until your check out its been so wonderfull staff. check in was wonderfull. the spa was ouer most wonderfull treat and would recomend it to all my friends and family in the U.K. its been a short stay but def a wondefull sea side to return to and to alll the great staff welldone

What a stunning backdrop to any photo. Whilst we did not have time to get to the top we were able to enjoy the views from the beach at Camps Bay.It was possible to take in these peaks and get some really great pictures with the Twelve Apostles in the background.There are plenty of places to eat along the promenade.

Best View. There are more than Twelve Apostles but who cares. The view off the Apostles looking back from Clifton over Camps Bay is one of the iconic views in Cape Town and South Africa and should not be missed by any world traveller to South Africa.

LEOPARD LOUNGE. There is not better spot for a winter sundowner in the Leopard Lounge. With the fire place crackling away and the live band/singer the barman will make sure you have an authentic Twelve Apostles cocktail or some of the best wines of Cape Town. My favourite sundowner venue.
Stunning View from the Coastline. The Twelve Apostles offer a stunning view from the Coastline, and I believe you can climb to the top as well.

Loved my stay at the 12 Apostles!. Loved my stay at the 12 Apostles! Very elegant hotel with scenic views and attentive staff. Because of the hotel’s size and staff’s attention to detail, I felt as if it were “my” hotel!
Adventure Climb. Several Trails to Explore Hiking and Out Door Adventure for All. Great Views and Scenery.From Land or See also make for an Excellent Photo Opp.

The perfect backdrop for the magnificent Camps Bay!. We walked along a small section of this spectacular mountain range when we ascended Table Mountain. The views along the range & town to the gorgeous sands of Camps Bay is truly breath taking.
Average. You get a view of the 18 apostles(yes ,there are 18 and not 12) from table top. Can be skipped if you are in a hurry, else can be clubbed along with table top mountain
beautiful place!. very upmarket, beautiful interior, great high tea, exellent service.....pricy but beautiful! at least have tea there!
Nice mountains. It's close to table mountain really so you can see a part of it from there. The whole mountain range is interesting anyway, not just this part.
Beautiful scenery. The twelve apostles were beautiful as was the story of their naming due to giving thanks for safe arrival on land, thus the name. Great for photography.

12 Apostles. a super high standard hotel experience - throughout the hotel all staff were absolutely brilliant achieving excellent service levels consistently, Masood the Concerierge was outstanding and a true credit to the conceriege role.
misty view. I am sure these would have looked much better on a dry day. Unfortunately the day we saw them they were shrouded in mist

ODCA Conference at 12 Apostles Hotel. I just wanted to drop you a personal note of thanks for the all of your support and arrangements to enable our successful conference last week! I was unable to speak to you in person, but can confirm the following:1. The Alliance members were very happy with the hotel and facilities and support / arrangements.2. Everyone was particularly impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.3. There were many remarks on the pride which your team showed in both the hotel and the city and country – obviously a hand-picked group.4. Many people expressed a desire to come back again in the future with their families, which is what we all want! Thank you again for helping us to have a successful conference, and making the visit so pleasant for all of our guests.

azure restaurant. We had dinner at this restaurant last night....Onela Soygye rolled out the red carpet for us. He paired our wines perfectly with each course of food. The food was some of the most amazing cuisine my palet has ever encountered. I highly recommend the springbok. Staff went above and beyond. Thank you Onela you were amazing!

Twelve Apostles across the ocean. Had a wonderful birthday breakfast at the Terrace Restaurant.Peach of a morning .. could see forever over the ocean. Food first rate and a birthday cake with champagne such a nice surprise as hosted by friend. Glorious way to initiate a fab celebratory day.
trip into heaven. Wonderfull driving route ! Something comming from Belgium you can only dream of ! fantastic scenery, stunning !

Twelve Apostles. This is the name of the mountains range. They look really magnificent. You can get a good look at them from the table mountain and Clifton Beach too. It looks lovely when you see the clouds covering it partially.

Stunning Mountain Range. Twelve Apostles are a stunning mountain range in the area of Camps and Hout Bay, one of the best views of the range is from Clifton Beach. You can visit the Twelve Apostles on the hop on / hop off bus or by car, if you go by car you can travel the length of Victoria Drive, a beautiful drive alongside the ocean. It is a beautiful area with glorious sunsets.

Amazing views,tranquility and peaceful. The 12 Apostle hotel and spa is the ideal getaway for nature lovers as it is located at the foot of the mountains with amazing restaurants and sea views.Very pricey, but value for money

One of the highlights on your trip around the Cape Peninsula. This hill range spanning from the Table Mountain along the coast over Camps Bay to Hout Bay is accompanying you on the road around the Cape Peninsula. It doesn't matter from which direction you are approaching this phantastic area, you cannot miss this master piece of land. Have a stop for a while and watch the busy ado at the beaches, the wonderful land and buildings or even walk on one of the hiking trails.

12 apostle spa. If you looking for good therapists, friendly staff and professional service, I will definately recommend the 12 apostle spa. The new modern look is amazing - loved it!The management and staff treated us like royalty which made our visit extra special. Well done to the 12A spa managenent!
One of South Africa's best. The new look of the spa gives it a modern feel. The friendly and well-trained staff turns a great experience into a memorable one. The view probably one of the best.

Five star all the way. We just love the Red Carnation Group of hotels. In South Africa and abroad. U know u r going to get the very best of best always with a perfect setting great food and excellent service.
Clifton beach views. The best views of the Twelve Apostles is from the Clifton Beach and the Chapman's Peak. This is a lovely mountain range.
Great Scenic Drive. We drove along the road below the Twelve Apostles. It was a beautiful view and had plenty stops to get out and admire the view.

Hidden Cannons. We visited while on the Hop on Hop off Bus Tour. It is interesting to note that these mountains contain caves that were used to hide cannons during the past wars. They were used to protect the Cape from enemy ships. The cannons can shoot out from their hiding places and were difficult to spot from the sea. Some of these cannons still function as we discovered at the Simonstown Naval Fair when they were fired as part of the show.

Great place to visit!. We had a superb meal at the lavishly decorated Twelve Apostles Hotel and enjoyed the view and the scenic drive along the coastline. This is an absolute must when you visit Cape Town!

Breathtaking sunsets. The Twelve Apostles have a great setting for sun downers with beautiful sunsets to be seen from their bar patio. They have an amazing Spa (for treatments) which is situated in a cave like setting. Wonderful floatation tank inside Spa.

Afternoon Tea. Try the afternoon tea here and you will not be disappointed. We tried to make a reservation at the Mount Nelson in Cape Town but it was full, so we begrudgingly decided on the 12 Apostles, and we absolutely loved it. The service, ambiance and stunning views were excellent and the food glorious!!

Fabulous Function Space. I held my wedding rehearsal dinner in the Atlantic Terrace Marquee. Everything from the service to the food, decor and overall experience was fantastic. The staff were incredibly attentive and made sure that all guests needs were met.Monique was fantastic throughout the planning process and made everything seamless for us especially since we were planning from USA.All guests had fantastic things to say about the venue and the staff.

Unforgettable. The Twelve Apostles, part of Table Mountain mountain range will be worth the drive - there is not much else to do there other than visit the Twelve Apostles Hotel, which we did not have time to do, but it will definitely be on our next visit.
More for your money. I think there are about 18 apostles in this wonderful view of the mountains overlooking Camp's Bay. A superb sight to behold.

decadance. beautiful hotel, rooms are lovely, beds are great, fantastic views a very upmarket hotel. just did not like the spa. went back a few years later and the spa had got even worse. pity as the hotel itself is great but would go back in a flash...

Location, Location, Location. A great hotel, tremendous service (they go out of their way to please you) excellent restaurant and one of the greatest locations on the planet. Have drinks outside and soak in the the 360 degree view of the ocean and the 12 apostle mountain backdrop.The only negative to a full 5 star rating was that some of the rooms are looking a bit tired and in need of maintenance

12 Apostles Cape Town. The 12 Apostles are a spectacular mountain feature between Camps bay and Hout bay. You can travel along the base of the apostles while hugging the ocean as you travel along Victoria drive.Many times you will spot dolphins in the sea on one side and the unspoiled mountains on the other. Not quite Chapman's peak drive in it's beauty but still one of the Cape's best drives.
THE MOUNTAINS AND THE HOTEL. The Twelve Apostles Hotel is one of my ffvourite luxury places and it is situated against the backdrop of beautiful mountain peaks, called the Twelve Apostels.
Elegant. Classy, elegant, superb service and food. Fantastic views. Great venue for conferences. Love the spa!
We need the6 more. This is a most beautiful coastline along the Atlantic and the perfect place to end a day. The sunsets are beautiful and what better place to hear and feel the sea?!

Pretty?. It's pretty here, but if you live near a beach or have seen beaches before, this is not anything special. Yes, there are some rock formations. We did a drive by, everybody looked, then we were ready to go. It is a nice area but if you are limited on time I would not put this on your "must do" list.
Worth of view. Great view of Cape Town, if you are in Cape Town, then a must see, highly recommend, it creates the whole atmosfere of the Cape.

An amazingly beautiful drive. After fighting through the traffic in the urban areas, this drive is a welcome relief and a marriage of nature and urbanisation. Set at the foot of Table Mountain it gives the best view of sunsets in the Cape Peninsula.
Still dont see it.. There is nothing unique or interesting about these mountain ridges. There really aren't a distinguishable 12 apostles like there are in Australia which is amazing.

Great place for drinks at sunset. Excellent place to have a drink. The bar balcony looks over the ocean and it's a stunning view. Patrons are served a snack platter of nuts, olives, etc and they just keep 'em coming! Great service. Staff are always presentable, friendly and professional.
Excellent. Luxury, style, service and above all the beautiful setting at the foot of the mountains and the endless ocean with breathtaking sunsets
stunning. beautiful and lovely to be next to such a nice back drop to the beautiful beaches all along the coast line
BEAUTIFUL VIEWS. along the side of Table MOuntain. Best done by car, although some do cycle. good views of the Twelve Apostles (mountains) from Camps Bay beach at it's foot..
Scenic drive. Beautiful scenic drive along this stretch of coastline. Views are unbelievable! And a good spot to stop and have tea at the hotel!
Great View. See if you can count the 12 Apostles, I might do it a few times, great views of Cape Town and the surrounding area.
Costly but nice. If you have the money, this is a wonderful break away. But be aware! Could leave a hole in your budget.
Sundowner spot. Good for sundowners but the road beneath can be busy and disturbing.
Beutiful. Great Hotel, beutiful food and spa - pricy but nice

Very nice set of peaks, another nice add-on for Cape Town. The twelve apostle mountains that line the Cape Town coastline are very nice, helping create a nice setting for this amazing city. It is nice looking at them driving up from Camps bay area to the V&A waterfront and towards the city centre, you can get lots of good pictures of them this way. They are also quite visible from the City Sightseeing tour but you've to look at them from the mountainside seats, while most are trying to peer out to the sea. On their own, the twelve apostles are quite overshadowed by the presence of Table mountain and to a lesser extent Lion's Head. However, they do make yet another nice addition to this city, worth at least a dozen photo shots.
Magic. Magic views and hiking paths, excellent views over the bay

Stunning Scenery. The Twelve Apostles Mountains were stunning in scenery. I hired a driver and went on a scenic tour around the southern coastline. The views were beautiful from every turn and corner.

Great attraction to see while on a cruise or Hiking.. The Twelve Apostles are a group of small mountain peaks that run along the coast of the Indian ocean in South Africa. They are visible as you drive along the coastal highways in Cape Town. Don and I, had the opportunity of enjoying the sight of these beautiful peaks while we were in Cape Town.We had a second viewing when we tool a cruise to Robeen Island from the Victoria and Alfred waterfront. Now I wish we had hiked, but the say we drove along the weather was not that great. I would recommend hiking along the path for a better view and enjoying being at higher grounds.Many people confuse the Twelve Apostles in South Africa with those in Australia. The Australian ones seem to be more popular than the South African ones, nonetheless, they are such a picturesque sight to see and photograph.

The beautiful mountains, not the hotel. This is the 'Things to do' section...so not for reviews of the hotel by the same name!! (Please do not review the hotel here).The Twelve Apostles is a range of small mountain peaks that run along the coast with the beautiful suburb of Camps Bay against its slopes.The 12 Apostles are great to look at, take pictures of from a sunset cruise (available from the Waterfront) or to walk along its hiking paths (please check this is still done and hike in groups of 4 or more close to Cape Town centre).
